<<<<<<< HEAD
An excellent new song, call'd, The praise of women. Or, Wine, women and musick. Being a playhouse song to a pleasant new tune.
1 sheet ([1] p.) : music.
Printed and sold by Tho. Moore, London, : 1695.
Verse: "How lovely's a woman before she's enjoy'd, when the spirits are strong, & the fancy not cloy'd ..." Printed in two columns. Imperfect: mutilated, affecting text. Reproduction of original in the British Library.
=======
